title: Commission Regulation (EC) No 1290/98 of 22 June 1998 definitively fixing the aid for unginned cotton from 1 September 1997 to 31 March 1998 for the 1997/98 marketing year
header:
COMMISSION REGULATION (EC) No 1290/98 of 22 June 1998 definitively fixing the aid for unginned cotton from 1 September 1997 to 31 March 1998 for the 1997/98 marketing year
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: The aid on unginned cotton corresponding to the world prices fixed in Commission Regulations (EC) No 1700/97 (8), (EC) No 1736/97 (9), (EC) No 1829/97 (10), (EC) No 1908/97 (11), (EC) No 1949/97 (12), (EC) No 2159/97 (13), (EC) No 2245/97 (14), (EC) No 2367/97 (15), (EC) No 2547/97 (16), (EC) No 2642/97 (17), (EC) No 29/98 (18), (EC) No 102/98 (19), (EC) No 207/98 (20), (EC) No 253/98 (21), (EC) No 391/98 (22), (EC) No 479/98 (23) and (EC) No 606/98 (24) shall be as set out in the Annex hereto, which amount shall be fixed definitively from the entry into force of each of the Regulations concerned.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the third day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
